values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_DRAGONPAST_PVE_2
values.value:
During the Storming of the Dragonpit, Prince Joffrey left the safety of Maegor's Holdfast to free the chained dragons. Seven dragonriders in service to their queen rode out and faced the mob to secure the young heir, but by the time they arrived the prince had already been killed after being thrown from his dragon, Syrax. The Ride of the Seven became a famous tale for singers ever since.

Defeat any non-event creature on the map to earn points! While this event is active, non-event creatures drop materials for the new Dance of Dragons trinket, which can be crafted for points in the Storming of the Dragonpit event.
Part of the 'Dragons of the Past' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_CRAFT_1
values.value:
The Curse of Harrenhal may be a myth, but its castellans have a habit of dying terribly. Six houses held Harrenhal before House Whent, all extinguished within a few generations. Its prior owner Lady Lothston is rumored to have fed on human flesh — the Whents, her sworn knights, turned on her when she went mad and claimed the castle upon her defeat.

Craft any event gear to earn points! Dark Steel Plate materials for the Living Mountain gear set are available in other Tourney at Harrenhal events. 
Part of the 'Tourney at Harrenhal' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_CRAFT_2
values.value:
King Aerys II had already begun his descent into madness before the tourney at Harrenhal. In an unexpected turn, he arrived for the feast, with hair long and unkempt and nails yellow and twisted. It was plain to see madness had taken him. As paranoid as ever, he wanted to ensure that his enemies were in check; even going so far as to send the prince to find a mysterious knight who entered the tourney late with an unknown sigil.

Craft any Trinket to earn points! Earn materials for the Riding Spurs Trinket by defeating creatures in the Enter the Lists event. 
Part of the 'Tourney at Harrenhal' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_PVE_1
values.value:
Though combat is the heart of the tourney, Lord Whent has spared no expense on other entertainment. Archers compete with bow and throwing-axe at a hundred paces, lords race their fastest horses, even singers compete in a tourney of their own. By night, the Hall of a Hundred Hearths is filled with feasting, dance, and drink.

Defeat Elite Knights to earn points! 
Part of the 'Tourney at Harrenhal' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_PVE_2
values.value:
Louder and louder cheers rise from the crowd as, one by one, the finest knights in Westeros fall to the dust under Rhaegar Targaryen's lance. Finally, the dragon prince claims the champion's laurel, a wreath of rare winter roses as blue as frost, and rides forth to name his Queen of Love and Beauty.

Defeat any non-event creature on the map to earn points! While this event is active, non-event creatures drop materials for the new Riding Spurs trinket, which can be crafted for points in the Arrival of the King event. 
Part of the 'Tourney at Harrenhal' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_PVE_RALLY_1
values.value:
Howland Reed traveled from the wetlands of the Neck to see an historic spectacle unfold at Harrenhal, and was met with three squires with prejudice in their hearts. They called him 'frog eater' and beat him with blunted tourney swords until a voice called out: "That's my father's man!" Then the she-wolf, Lyanna Stark, came to his rescue - fending off each scoundrel with ease.

Defeat Elite Knights (Grand Melee) to earn points! 
Part of the 'Tourney at Harrenhal' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_TRADE_1
values.value:
The year of the False Spring began as most springs do, with a sense of renewal, and the tourney at Harrenhal would be a catalyst for love, for beauty, and for war. But on the night of the opening ceremonies, food and drink will spill in the Hall of a Hundred Hearths without thoughts of such consequences; so eat, drink, and be merry!

Fresh Blue Rose Petals trophy recipes are available while this event is active. Exchange Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies in the Recipes tab of your Inventory to earn points! 
Part of the 'Tourney at Harrenhal' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_TRADE_2
values.value:
281 AC - The year of the false spring gave a fleeting hope to a kingdom that it’s years-long Winter would be over sooner than the maester’s of Oldtown could predict. This gave a rare opportunity for the Lords and Ladies of Westeros to meet at Harrenhal for a celebration of Lord Whent’s daughter’s nameday. Knowing what followed after the events of Lord Whent’s tourney, it isn’t clear whether the false spring was a benevolent act of the Seven, or one of retribution by the old gods.

Exchange Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies in the Recipes tab of your Inventory to earn points. This event's Recipes are your last chance to use Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies before they can only be exchanged for Trader's Scrip! 
Part of the 'Tourney at Harrenhal' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_UMBRELLA_1
values.value:
The day is warm, though winter has not yet ended. In honor of Lord Whent's daughter's nameday the dark fortress of Harrenhal is adorned with banners; cheers and battle-clangor fill the air. Challengers from far and wide have come to test their mettle. Even Prince Rhaegar Targaryen, who seldom rides in tournaments, is preparing to enter the lists.

Look for these Featured Rewards throughout the Tourney at Harrenhal event:
* Dark Steel Plate is used to craft the Living Mountain gear set!
* Riding Spurs Components are used to craft the Riding Spurs trinket!
* Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies can be traded for prizes in the Recipes tab of your Inventory while the Opening Ceremonies or Year of the False Spring events are active. Remember to use all your Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies before the Year of the False Spring event ends!

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_UMBRELLA_2
values.value:
A murmur of confusion goes up from the crowd. Wearing mismatched armor and a full-face helm, a mystery knight rides into the lists and challenges three specific knights. They break their lances in vain against his shield, blazoned with a smiling white weirwood. Satisfied, the Knight of the Laughing Tree vanishes before the next dawn.

Look for these Featured Rewards throughout the Tourney at Harrenhal event:
* Dark Steel Plate is used to craft the Living Mountain gear set!
* Riding Spurs Components are used to craft the Riding Spurs trinket!
* Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies can be traded for prizes in the Recipes tab of your Inventory while the Opening Ceremonies or Year of the False Spring events are active. Remember to use all your Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies before the Year of the False Spring event ends!

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HARRENHAL3_UMBRELLA_3
values.value:
With a shout, seven teams of knights charge to the center of the field for a melee in the ancient style. Robert Baratheon, the fierce young Lord of Storm's End, swings his hammer and sends a lesser warrior flying. He fights with more than his usual fervor knowing Lyanna Stark, his beloved and betrothed, is watching from the gallery.

Look for these Featured Rewards throughout the Tourney at Harrenhal event:
* Dark Steel Plate is used to craft the Living Mountain gear set!
* Riding Spurs Components are used to craft the Riding Spurs trinket!
* Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies can be traded for prizes in the Recipes tab of your Inventory while the Opening Ceremonies or Year of the False Spring events are active. Remember to use all your Fresh Blue Rose Petal trophies before the Year of the False Spring event ends!

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HOTD_4_HEROPOWER_1
values.value:
Under the command of Maegor the Cruel, the construction of a great stone 'stable' for the dragons of King’s Landing began. Such was the scale of the undertaking that it was said thirty horseback knights could ride side-by-side through its mighty iron doors. Despite its size, the Dragon Pits still could not truly meet the needs of the massive creatures. Caged in on all sides under the great domed roof of the pit, each new generation of Targaryen dragons was doomed to be smaller than the last. The Dragon Pits now lie in ruin atop the Hill of Rhaenys, a stark reminder of what happens when you try to cage a dragon.

Navigate to the Tower of the Hand in your city to manage and upgrade your
collection. Earn points by unlocking and leveling up Heroes! 
Part of the 'Dragons of King's Landing' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_HOTD_4_UMBRELLA_1
values.value: When Aegon I Targaryen conquered the Seven Kingdoms, he chose not to embrace the more established city of Old Town as his capital. Instead, he built upon the spot where his ships first landed from Dragonstone. As his conquest spread, so did the scale and power of the city. While the Targaryen dynasty no longer reigns, you can still spot the influence of the house of the dragon throughout the city-- from the ruins of the great Dragon Pits upon the Hill of Rhaenys, to the basement of the Red Keep where the last of the Targaryen dragon’s skulls still remain. Celebrate the release of House of the Dragon and claim unique rewards! * New Dragon Customization options are available now! * Build and upgrade the Dragon Lore Excavation plot by completing Daily Quests! * A new Dragon Hero, Rhaegal "The Green Fury," is available to claim in the Dragon Pits event, or by praying at the Shrine and completing Daily Quests! * A new March Pawn, Dragon's Dominion, is available! Collect Dragon's Dominion Pawn Shards in the Skulls in the Cellar event, or by praying at the Shrine and completing Daily Quests!

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_NIGHTKING_NARRATIVE_1
values.value:
Thousands of blades defended against the onslaught, and one blade ended it. Death's cold blue eyes are closed.

In a few days we will release more information about the Battle of Winterfell event, including <<DESCRIBE ANALYTICS HERE>>. Check back soon!

Part of the 'Battle of Winterfell' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_NWM_KOTH_2
values.value:
The mutineers are trapped in an unfortified castle with low morale and dwindling supplies. Your allies have given you every possible advantage in this fight. Now is the time to strike!

Capture event-limited Seats of Power to earn points! Eastwatch-by-the-Sea, the Shadow Tower, the Nightfort, and Castle Black will unlock for short windows of time during each Hour of the Wolf round event. To help you capture these Seats of Power, special Boosts are available in the Item Exchange tab of your Inventory. While you hold one of these Seats of Power, you and any Bannermen to whom you assign titles will receive points every minute. Maintain control of your Seat of Power for as long as possible to earn maximum points!
Part of the 'Night's Watch Mutiny' Event

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION_VALENTINES_GEMS_1
values.value:
"Merchants from the Jade Sea have arrived on the shores of Westeros with abundant stores of gold!

Celebrate Valentine's Day with EVEN MORE GOLD! Using Gems to redeem bundles in the Store awards points towards this event.
If the purchases made with Gems contain Gold, that Gold will contribute to the progress of the separate Valentines Day Celebration Event. Daily Deliveries and Rewards Passes only award points for initial gold received at the time of purchase. Rewards must be collected before the promotion ends."

values.name: ACTIVITY_DESC_WARFORTHETHRONE_PVP_ST_1
values.value:
The threat from beyond the sea sparks mayhem in Westeros! Steel yourself and take what you need to prosper in the new order!

The Kingdom versus Kingdom invasion has begun! Earn points from defeating your enemy's troops! Earn additional points for defeating troops at Strategic Terrain!
Earn points for gathering at Strategic Terrain, clearing nodes, and executing Battlefield Salvage Recipes!
Invaders can attack and hold Seats of Power on rival Kingdoms!

Part of the 'War for the Throne' Event

values.name: DRAGON_HUB_HEADER
values.value: Dragon Pit

values.name: DRAGON_HUB_INFO
values.value: The Dragon Pit houses your fearsome dragon. Visit regularly to feed your dragon, help it grow, train it to accompany your armies, and study lost histories to unlock its full potential. When your dragon is wounded, it will rest here until healed.

values.name: DRAGON_INFO_BATTLE_PARAGRAPH_1
values.value: As your dragon develops, they will be able to learn two unique abilities from the research tree accessible from the Dragon Pit: Repel Strike and Fire Breath.

values.name: DRAGON_INFO_BATTLE_PARAGRAPH_3
values.value: Tenacity is used whenever Repel Strike is triggered. The amount of Tenacity consumed is linked to how much damage it does. Tenacity can be charged for free occasionally at the Dragon Pit.

values.name: DRAGON_INFO_BATTLE_PARAGRAPH_6
values.value:
There are a couple ways to increase the stats of your dragon. You can research nodes on a research tree, add points to their Talents, or equip gear to yourself and your dragon.

Under the Stats tab on the main screen of the Dragon
Pit, you can see a breakdown of all bonus stats applied to your dragon. You dragon’s stats can impact:
* Dragon health and regeneration
* Dragon attack and defense
* Attack and defense for all troop types
* Resource gathering
* March size and speed 
* and more...

values.name: DRAGON_INFO_BODY2
values.value: After acquiring enough experience, your dragon has special requirements for a level increase, such as Dragon Research and knowledge of Dragon Lore. Get Dragon Lore through: * Daily Quests * Dragon Pit Upgrades * Dragon Levels * Events * Special Offers

values.name: DRAGON_INFO_BODY2a
values.value: After acquiring enough experience, your dragon has special requirements for a level increase, such as Dragon Research and knowledge of Dragon Lore. Get Dragon Lore through: * Daily Quests * Dragon Pit Upgrades * Dragon Levels * Events * Special Offers

values.name: DRAGON_INFO_TRAINING_PARAGRAPH_1
values.value:
The Dragon Pit houses your fearsome dragon. Visit regularly to feed your dragon, help it grow, train it to accompany your armies, equip it with armor to strengthen your army, and study lost histories to 
unlock its full potential. When you dragon is wounded, it will rest here until healed.

values.name: DRAGON_INFO_TRAINING_PARAGRAPH_3
values.value:
After acquiring enough experience, your dragon has special requirements for a level increase, such as Dragon Research and knowledge of Dragon Lore.

Get Dragon Lore through:
* Daily Quests
* Dragon Pit Upgrades
* Dragon Levels
* Events
* Special Offers

values.name: EXPEDITION_DESCRIPTION_MASTEROFWAR_DRAGONPIT
values.value: Faced with overpowering numbers, even dragons are vulnerable. The Dance of Dragons led to widespread fear as smallfolk were caught in the crossfire between warring Targaryen factions. In 130 AC a mob of smallfolk descended on the Dragonpit, hoping to kill Queen Rhaenyra's dragons while they were chained and sleeping. Hundreds of smallfolk died in the attempt, but so did five dragons.

values.name: SYSTEM_MESSAGE_ STAKEYOURCLAIM_PREEVENT
values.value:
Soon, the allegiances in your kingdom, along with those in two other kingdoms, will set forth on a new adventure. You will leave your current kingdoms behind as you look for new territory to stake your claim in. 
When the event starts, owners of Seats of Power will be evicted from their seats as everyone in the kingdom prepares to look for a new permanent home to conquer. During this time, Seats of Power in your home kingdom cannot be attacked or taken. Allegiances compete by holding as many Seats of Power as possible in any of the new kingdoms, rewarding them with event points. Points earned will not be lost when traveling to another kingdom. In the new kingdoms, Seats of Power will unlock using an accelerated schedule, each day providing better seats to conquer. Points earned during the event will depend on the seat being held by the allegiance. Bonus points are earned if your T1 is on the same kingdom. When the event ends, allegiances and their members will win rewards based on the total number of points earned. The Seat of Power unlock schedule will return to normal at the conclusion of the event.
There will be 4 new kingdoms available to pick from while the event is active, and you can freely travel to any of these kingdoms throughout the event. The event panel will include a "Stake Your Claim" teleport action allowing you to select a kingdom. Once you leave your original kingdom you cannot return as travel is only permitted between the new kingdoms.
It's important for you to know that at the end of the event you will be moved to the kingdom your T1 resides.
If you have not selected a new kingdom by the end of the event, you will be randomly moved to one. If a kingdom is overpopulated at the conclusion of the event, some allegiances will be moved to another kingdom. 

Good luck and thank you for playing Game of Thrones: Conquest!
